Package it.polimi.middlewaretechfordistsys.p2.actors

Class ComputeActor

java.lang.Object
akka.actor.AbstractActor
it.polimi.middlewaretechfordistsys.p2.actors.ComputeActor
All Implemented Interfaces:
akka.actor.Actor
public class ComputeActor
extends akka.actor.AbstractActor
This class represents the server computational actor, which can be seen as a sort of model of our application. In fact, it contains the application logic necessary for a correct behavior of the system. Its job is to: - register new nodes in the list of the existent ones; - retrieve information about them from the list of all nodes.

  • Method Details

    • createReceive

      public akka.actor.AbstractActor.Receive createReceive()
      Specified by:
      createReceive in class akka.actor.AbstractActor

    • onRegistration

      public void onRegistration​(RegistrationMessage registrationMessage)
      This method is triggered when a new registration message is received from the client actor. It checks if that node is already registered and, if not, proceeds to a registration.
      Parameters:
      registrationMessage - the incoming registration message.

    • onMessage

      public void onMessage​(NodeRedMessage message)
      This method is triggered when new node red message is received from the client actor. It checks the destination node and ping it, in order to establish if it is still reachable. If the destination is not reachable, it returns an exception to the client.
      Parameters:
      message - the incoming message.
      See Also:
      NodeRedMessage

    • props

      public static akka.actor.Props props()

    • pingHost

      public static boolean pingHost​(java.lang.String host, int port, int timeout)
      Static method to ping an host through a socket on the node-red running port.
      Parameters:
      host - the host to ping.
      port - the port on which node-red is assumed to be running.
      timeout - a maximum timeout value.
      Returns:
      true if the host is reachable, false if it times out.
